title: William Wakefield (cricketer)
text:
William Henry Wakefield (20 May 1870 – 7 August 1922) was an <a href="English%20people">English</a> first-class <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er.
The son of <a href="William%20Henry%20Wakefield">William Henry Wakefield</a> of <a href="Sedgwick%20House%2C%20Cumbria">Sedgwick House</a> and his wife, Augusta Hagarty, he was born at <a href="Kendal">Kendal</a> in May 1870. He was educated at <a href="Charterhouse%20School">Charterhouse School</a>, before going up to the <a href="University%20of%20Oxford">University of Oxford</a>. While at Oxford, he played <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> for <a href="Oxford%20University%20RFC">Oxford University</a>. He toured the West Indies with <a href="R.%20S.%20Lucas%27%20XI%20cricket%20team%20in%20the%20West%20Indies%20in%201894%E2%80%9395">R. S. Lucas' XI in 1894–95</a>, making his debut in <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> on the tour against <a href="Barbados%20national%20cricket%20team">Barbados</a> at <a href="Kensington%20Oval">Bridgetown</a>. He made five further first-class appearances on the tour, scoring 30 runs with a high score of 16. Playing as the touring party's <a href="wicket-keeper">wicket-keeper</a>, Wakefield also took 10 catches and made 5 <a href="stumping">stumping</a>s. Two years later he again toured the West Indies, this time with <a href="Lord%20Hawke%27s%20XI%20cricket%20team%20in%20the%20West%20Indies%20in%201896%E2%80%9397">Lord Hawke's XI</a>, with Wakefield making seven first-class appearances on the tour. He scored 45 runs on the tour, with a high score of 19 <a href="not%20out">not out</a>. As the team's wicket-keeper, he took 8 catches and made a single stumping. He died at <a href="Chesham">Chesham</a> in August 1922.
